sentences.en: And some of them are so insolent.
sentences.cn: 何况他们中间有些人是那么粗野无礼.

sentences.en: Are you not first going to punish this insolent boy?
sentences.cn: 你不先收拾一下那蛮横的小子 吗 ?

sentences.en: At these insolent words her anger rose.
sentences.cn: 听了这些傲慢无礼的话,她冒火了.

sentences.en: His insolent manner really got my blood up.
sentences.cn: 他那专横的态度把我的肺都气炸了.

sentences.en: I put my request in an absurd, almost insolent form.
sentences.cn: 我把我的请求用荒谬的甚至无礼的形式说出来了.

sentences.en: It was insolent of them to demand special treatment.
sentences.cn: 他们要求给予特殊待遇,脸皮真厚.

sentences.en: Mr. Carton's manner was so careless as to be almost insolent.
sentences.cn: 卡尔顿先生一副满不在乎的神气,几乎有点无礼.

sentences.en: She is the most insolent creature I ever put my eyes on.
sentences.cn: 她是我见到过的最傲慢无礼的人啦.

sentences.en: The bandit bared his teeth in an insolent smile.
sentences.cn: 那匪徒龇牙咧嘴地狞笑.

sentences.en: The officer stamped his boot. 'Don't be insolent with me, mademoiselle.'
sentences.cn: 军官跺跺靴子：“小姐，别对我无礼。”

sentences.en: The officer stamped his boot. "Don't be insolent with me, mademoiselle."
sentences.cn: 军官跺跺靴子：“小姐，别对我无礼。”

sentences.en: The reply was couched in insolent terms.
They are the more insolent, and it is the nearer ended.
sentences.cn: 他们越放肆, 结局就越近.

sentences.en: They proceeded in silence along the gravel walk that led to the copse; Elizabeth was determined to make no effort for conversation with a woman who was now more than usually insolent and disagreeable.
sentences.cn: 两人默默无声地沿着一条通到小树林的鹅卵石铺道往前走。 伊丽莎白只觉得这个老妇人比往常更傲慢，更其令人讨厌，因此拿定主张，决不先开口跟她说话。

sentences.en: They were insolent and overbearing to the servants and friends of Penelope.
sentences.cn: 他们对待佩内洛普的仆人和朋友傲慢无礼.

sentences.en: Well, he had shown the insolent fellow the door.
sentences.cn: 哼, 他已经把那个傲慢无礼的家伙赶走了.

trans.tran_cn: 侮慢的，无礼的，张狂，傲睨一世
trans.tran_en: rude and not showing any respect
